content:
IContextProperty Interface

Definition

Gathers naming information from the context property and determines whether the new context is ok for the context property.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public interface IContextProperty

Remarks

The IContextProperty interface is exposed by the property contributed to a context by an attribute. By default, it is also implemented by the ContextAttribute base class, from which Context attribute classes can extend.

Properties

Name

Gets the name of the property under which it will be added to the context.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of the property.

Methods

Freeze(Context)

Called when the context is frozen.

public void Freeze (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context newContext);
Parameters
newContext
Context

The context to freeze.

Remarks

Context properties cannot be added after the context has been frozen.

IsNewContextOK(Context)

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the context property is compatible with the new context.

public bool IsNewContextOK (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context newCtx);
Parameters
newCtx
Context

The new context in which the ContextProperty has been created.

Returns
Boolean

true if the context property can coexist with the other context properties in the given context; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Once all the context properties have been added to the new context, they are all queried as to whether they are okay in the new context. The context property could look at the other context properties from newCtx and determine whether it is compatible with these other context properties.
